intro: Galanthus reginae-olgae, commonly known as the Queen of the Alps snowdrop, is a species of flowering plant in the Amaryllidaceae family. It is native to the alpine regions of Central Europe, particularly the Alps and Carpathian Mountains. The plant produces delicate white flowers with green tips, resembling other snowdrop species but with distinct characteristics. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in mountain meadows and forested areas. Galanthus reginae-olgae is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its early spring blooms.
